item.title: Fishing potion code
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

You have unnecessary things in it.

Yours:

case 151: //Fishing potion if (ItemID == 151) { playerLevel[10] += 1; refreshSkills(); actionTimer = 60; if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("The pot wears off."); } }

Change To:

case 151: //Fishing potion playerLevel[10] += 1; refreshSkills(); actionTimer = 60; if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("The pot wears off."); }

case 151, it already knows what the ItemID is.

You should make a different timer instead of action timer.

Like FishpotTimer, because it will intefere with alot. If you have training cases, you’ve probably set them up like this:

if(actionTimer == 0) {

Then the person will not be able to click and gain XP for the 6 seconds you’ve put, and 6 seconds seems like a short time to have it imo.

And of course under the process or whatever, you would have it check once that FishPotTImer has reached 0, it will return the players level back to normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing potion code
item.dc:creator: @Bacus23 Bacus23
item.description:
@Bacus23 wrote:

so like this

case 151: //Fishing potion if (ItemID == 151) { playerLevel[10] += 1; refreshSkills(); actionTimer = 60; if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("The pot wears off."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing potion code
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Search:

public boolean CheckForSkillUse3

Under:

switch (Item) {

Add the case, the case would be the ID of the fishing pot.

Look at the other cases to see what you can do. But if i’m not mistaken on most servers it should already be there, unless it was deleted.

EDIT:

Yeah you see i have…:

[code] case 155: // fish pot (1)
c.fishPot = true;
c.fishPotTimer = 120;
c.playerLevel[10] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[10]);
c.playerLevel[10] += 4;
c.sendFrame126("" + c.playerLevel[10] + “”, 4032);
c.deleteItem(155, c.GetItemSlot(155), 1);
c.addItem(229, 1);
c.updateRequired = true;
c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
GoOn = false;
break;

    case 153: // fish pot (2)
        c.fishPot = true;
        c.fishPotTimer = 120;
        c.playerLevel[10] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[10]);
        c.playerLevel[10] += 4;
        c.sendFrame126("" + c.playerLevel[10] + "", 4032);
        c.deleteItem(153, c.GetItemSlot(153), 1);
        c.addItem(155, 1);
        c.updateRequired = true;
        c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
        GoOn = false;
        break;

    case 151: // fish pot (3)
        c.fishPot = true;
        c.fishPotTimer = 120;
        c.playerLevel[10] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[16]);
        c.playerLevel[10] += 4;
        c.sendFrame126("" + c.playerLevel[10] + "", 4032);
        c.deleteItem(151, c.GetItemSlot(151), 1);
        c.addItem(153, 1);
        c.updateRequired = true;
        c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
        GoOn = false;
        break;

    case 2438: // fish pot (4)
        c.fishPot = true;
        c.fishPotTimer = 120;
        c.playerLevel[10] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[10]);
        c.playerLevel[10] += 4;
        c.sendFrame126("" + c.playerLevel[10] + "", 4032);
        c.deleteItem(2438, c.GetItemSlot(2438), 1);
        c.addItem(151, 1);
        c.updateRequired = true;
        c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
        GoOn = false;
        break;[/code]

Read full topic
